result.execSummary:
The defendant William Billy Harris Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Billy Harris Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, William Billy Harris Jr was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Billy Harris Jr is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • William Billy Harris Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • William Billy Harris Jr was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • William Billy Harris Jr was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • William Billy Harris Jr was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No posession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
No contact with Kathryn S., Markisha J. and Rachael J. or any Walgreens.
Under Section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Kathryn S., Markisha J. and Rachael J. as they were victim and/or witnesses in the crime in count five and it is in  the interest of the public to prohibit.
Comply with all child support Court orders.

Complete parenting or fatherhood course.
Successfuly complete Batterers Intervention program.
Fine set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under S. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
The Court advises the defendant that under  Wisconsin Statue 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcatd sentence  in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supevision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

*1/26/2016 Honorable Carolina Stark:  Court orders restitution as to count 3 in the amount of $575.52 payable to Sedgwick.  Restitution shall be paid first before court costs, fees, assesmsents and surcharges through colleciont by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be paid monthly and due by the end of extended supervision shall be due immediately and failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.*
Hearing January 29, 2016

As to all counts, court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, and as to count three domestic abuse assessments.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance shall be  due no later than 12/31/2017.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three, four and five in 15CF699; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 270 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Defendant William Billy Harris in court via video conference with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant William Billy Harris in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Restitution Hearing proceeded. Sworn: Rachael J. Exhibit 1 and 2 received. Closing arguments. 
Court orders restitution as to COUNT 3, in the amount of $575.52 payable to Sedgwick. 
Restitution shall be paid first before court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be paid monthly and due by the end of extended supervision; any remaining balance after extended supervision shall be due immediately, and failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.pk

records.addlTxt: Count five.
Counts three, four and six.

Defendant William Billy Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant William Billy Harris in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 3 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 4, 5 and 6 in 15CF699 and consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 90 days time served. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

AS TO COUNT 4 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 3, 5 and 6 in 15CF699 and consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 270 days time served. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 6 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 3, 4, and 5 in 15CF699 and consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 270 days time served. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

AS TO COUNT 5 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS 6 MONTHS, concurrent with Count 3, 4, and 6 in 15CF699 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 310 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS  6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- As to all counts court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, and as to count 3 domestic abuse assessments, to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2017; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Obtain/Maintain fulltime employment. 
- No contact with Kathryn S., Markisha J., and Rachael J. Or ANY Walgreens
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Successfully complete Batters Intervention  program. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Kathryn S., Markisha J., and Rachael J.  as they were victim and/or witnesses in the crime in COUNT 5 and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Jury question and response, received and filed. tk

Defendant William Billy Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt. Defendant William Billy Harris in custody. Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk
Jury trial continued.  At the hour of * the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of not guilty as to count 1 and 2, and verdict of guilty as to count 3, 4, 5, and 6 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts as to count 3, 4, 5, and 6 and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict as to count 3, 4, 5, and 6.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.
As to count 1 and 2 Court granted defenses motion for judgement of aquittal. Arguments heard as to bail 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for restitution hearing and sentencing hearing on 12-16-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.

VERDICT COUNT 1
"We, the jury, find the defendant, William Bill Harris, Jr., not guilty of Battery to M.J. in Count 1 of the information."
VERDICT COUNT 2
"We, the jury, find the defendant, William Bill Harris, Jr., not guilty of Intimidating a Witness M.J. in Count 2 of the information."
VERDICT COUNT 3
"We, the jury, find the defendant, William Bill Harris, Jr., guilty of Disorderly Conduct in Count 3 of the information."
VERDICT COUNT 4
"We, the jury, find the defendant, William Bill Harris, Jr., guilty of Battery to K.S. in Count 4 of the information."
VERDICT COUNT 5
"We, the jury, find the defendant, William Bill Harris, Jr., guilty of Intimidating a Witness, K.S. in Count 5 of the information."
VERDICT COUNT 6
"We, the jury, find the defendant, William Bill Harris, Jr., guilty of Criminal Damage to Property in Count 6 of the information."

Defendant William Billy Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt. Defendant William Billy Harris in custody. Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Jury trial proceeded. Changed jury instructions placed on the record. Jury in the box at 9:19 am. Court read substantive instructions to the jury. Alternate juror selected and released. 
 Jury retired at the hour of 9:37 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Berlin and Deputy Settingsgaard who were duly sworn for that purpose. Jury out of the box at 9:37am. 
 Jury question received and filed. Court sent written notice of instructions, received and filed.
Jury Exhibit List received and filed. tk

Defendant William Billy Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant William Billy Harris in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Trial proceeded.
Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to remain silent. 
Jury number 10 in the box at 9:27.  Juror 10 was questioned additionally. Court instructed Juror 10, out of the box at 9:30. Jury number 16 in the box at 9:32. Juror 16 was questioned additionally. Court instructed Juror 16, out of the box 9:33. Jury in the box at 9:40 am. Sworn for defense: William Billy Harris. Defense rest. State rest. Jury out of the box at 10:14 am. Juror number 27 in the box at 10:34.  Juror 27 was questioned additionally. Side bar requested. The rest of the jury in the box at 10:37am. Court instructed jury. Closing arguments. Court instructed jury and release for the weekend. Side bar requested. Jury out of the box at 11:49. Side bar placed on the record. Defense requested bail motion. Court denies request at this time. Defense to file bail motion in writing with court.

Defendant William Billy Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant William Billy Harris in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Trial proceeded. Jury in the box at 1:34 pm. Resworn for the state: Kathryn S.; Joseph Zientek: Officer-Wauwatosa Police Department; David Cefalu: Officer- Wauwatosa Police Department. Side bar requested. Second side bar requested. Jury out of the box at 2:20 pm. Officer Cefalu was excused from the court room. Both side bar placed on the record. Jury in the box at 2:39 pm. State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 2:43 pm.  Defense motion for directed verdict as to Count 1, 2 and 5 at close of state's case denied by the court. Court held colloqey with defendant and for reasons placed on the record, Court will allow defense to review discovery material with defendant, and case will be adjourned until 11-25-2015 at 9:00 am. Jury in the box at 3:45 pm. Court instructed the jury and released them for the evening. Side bar requested. Jury out of the box at 3:53 pm. Side bar placed on the record. Case adjourned for continued jury trial on 11-25-2015 at 9:00 am, branch 17.

Defendant William Billy Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant William Billy Harris in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Court ruled on prior convictions.  Jury in the box at 9:21 am. Sworn for the state:  Markisha S.; Jury out of the box. Jury in the box at 10:34 am. Sworn for the state: Kathryn S. Side Bar requested.  Exhibit  1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 received.  Court excused the jury for the lunch hour. Jury out of the box at 11:38 am. Side bar placed on the record.
From Defense; received and filed.
Jury List from 11-23-2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant William Billy Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant William Billy Harris in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Jury trial proceeded. Side bar placed on the record. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury in the box at 2:04 pm. Voir dire continued. Court instructed the jury and release for break. Jury out of the box at 3:20 pm. Juror number 11 to remain. Additional voir dire with juror 11. Juror 11 out of the box. Jury in the box at 3:55 pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense. Court instructed the juror and release for the evening. Jurors to return 11-24-2015 at 9:00. Jury out of the box at 4:51 pm. Defendant William Billy Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant William Billy Harris in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Defense motions to dismiss Count 5. Arguments heard. Court denied motion to dismiss Count 5. 
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:39.  Court instructed the jurors and release for the lunch hour. Jury out of the box at 12:00 pm. 

  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant William Billy Harris in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant William Billy Harris in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Juror asks to speak with the Court.  Court and parties question the juror as to an inability to serve on this case.  Defense moves to have the juror excused and declare a mistrial.  Defense moves to dismiss Count 5 as to no factual basis and insufficient jury instruction.  Argument by defense.  Court finds no problem with the jury instruction.  Based on the statements from the juror, Court excuses the juror and declares a mistrial.  Court orders the case to be returned to Br. 38, Judge Wagner for jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Jury in the box at 9:33 a.m.  Court releases the jury.  Jury out of the box at 9:34 a.m.

Parties are prepared to proceed to jury trial.  Parties impanel a jury of 12 good and lawful citizens of Milwaukee County.  Voire Dire:  3:08 p.m.  Kate Block and Sara Miller, American Sign Language, interpreters sworn-in for juror #1.  Jury out of the box at 3:37 p.m.  Jury in the box at 3:46 p.m.  Voire Dire continues.   Jury out of the box at 4:04 p.m.  Jury list received, filed and sealed.  Jury in the box at 4:15 p.m.  Jury sworn-in.  Court gives the jury preliminary instructions.  Opening statements by counsel.  Court adjourns case to 11-19-15 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury out of the box at 4:50 p.m.
